digest.editor_note: Fellow Humans, Nvidia just reported the quarter of its life and the market sold it off 5% — which tells you everything you need to know about where we are in the AI trade. Between a lukewarm reception for the most important chip company on earth, Bitcoin unwinding quietly under the cover of conspiracy theories, and mortgage rates finally cracking below 6% into a housing market that still can't get out of its own way, today's tape is a study in expectations that have simply gotten too heavy to carry.

sentiment.label: Cautious
sentiment.context: Nvidia's post-earnings selloff, Bitcoin's drawn-out distribution phase, and mixed oil markets signal a market wrestling with stretched AI valuations and macro uncertainty rather than outright panic.

stories.headline: Nvidia Falls 5% Post-Earnings as Wall Street Questions AI Demand Durability
stories.body: Nvidia beat on revenue, profit, and guidance — and investors still sold it down 5%, dragging the Nasdaq 1.3% lower. The issue isn't the numbers; it's what wasn't said: the forward guidance excludes potential China revenue, and management offered little on when the AI capex supercycle actually translates into returns for enterprise customers. The S&P 500 dropped 0.6% while the Dow scraped flat, underscoring a market increasingly willing to punish ambiguity at peak multiples.

stories.headline: Bitcoin's Decline Is Capitulation, Not Conspiracy — Bitwise CIO
stories.body: Speculation pinning Bitcoin's slide on Jane Street, Binance, and unnamed macro funds has been doing the rounds, but Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan's read is blunter: it's a textbook mid-cycle deleveraging, months in the making. The roughly 45% peak-to-trough drawdown shows the hallmarks of forced liquidation and margin cascade rather than coordinated manipulation — sharp moves, heavy volume near the lows, and a prior distribution phase visible well before February's acceleration. Selling pressure appears to be easing, though the structural damage to leveraged positioning is done.

stories.headline: 30-Year Mortgage Rate Drops Below 6% for First Time Since September 2022
stories.body: Freddie Mac put the benchmark 30-year fixed rate at 5.98% this week, its third consecutive decline and the lowest print in over three years. The 10-year Treasury yield sits at 4.02%, providing the gravitational pull. Despite the psychological milestone, existing home sales just posted their largest monthly drop in nearly four years — a reminder that rate relief alone cannot fix a market where nearly 69% of outstanding mortgages carry rates at or below 5%.

stories.headline: First U.S. Primary Aluminum Smelter Since 1980 to Break Ground in Oklahoma
stories.body: Emirates Global Aluminum and Century Aluminum are building a 750,000-ton annual capacity smelter in Inola, Oklahoma — the first new primary aluminum plant in the U.S. in 45 years — citing Trump's 50% tariff on the metal as a key enabling condition. The Supreme Court struck down Trump's broader tariff authority on February 20 but left the metals duties intact, which now appear to be actively reshaping industrial supply chains. Construction starts later this year; production is expected by end of decade.

stories.headline: Oil Settles Mixed as Iran Nuclear Talks Continue in Geneva
stories.body: Crude prices drifted without conviction as diplomats in Geneva continued negotiations over Iran's nuclear program, with cautious optimism keeping a lid on supply-premium pricing. A deal that restores Iranian barrels to the market would add meaningful supply at a moment when OPEC+ is already managing output carefully. Directional conviction in oil is on hold pending outcomes.

stories.headline: Bipartisan Bill Seeks to Shield DeFi Developers from Money Transmission Liability
stories.body: Representatives Fitzgerald, Cline, and Lofgren introduced the Promoting Innovation in Blockchain Development Act of 2026, targeting 18 U.S.C. Section 1960 — the statute used to prosecute Tornado Cash co-founders Roman Storm and Roman Semenov and the Samourai Wallet team. The bill would narrow the law's scope to entities with actual custody of user funds, explicitly carving out open-source developers. It arrives as Congress works through broader digital asset market structure legislation, and the stakes are high: Storm was convicted in August 2025, Samourai's leadership entered guilty pleas by November.

stories.headline: Solana Captures Over 41% of All Web3 DApp Revenue as RWA Ecosystem Hits $1.71B ATH
stories.body: Despite lackluster SOL price action, Solana now accounts for more than 41% of total Web3 decentralized application revenue according to data from Syndica, cited by SOL Strategies. The network's real-world asset ecosystem crossed $1.71 billion in on-chain value — a 45% surge in 30 days — pointing to accelerating institutional experimentation. HSDT's Pacific Backbone infrastructure launch, linking Seoul, Tokyo, Singapore, and Hong Kong, is being framed as the next potential catalyst for institutional capital inflows.

quote.text: Markets can remain irrational longer than you can remain solvent.
quote.attribution: John Maynard Keynes, A Tract on Monetary Reform, 1923
